_meanings:
<ab>N.</ab> of a celebrated lake, which is considered to
be the same as the river Pennair, near which
stands the Ṛṣyamūka mountain. The river is
known to rise from tanks; the northern part 
especially from a stone tank in the centre of 
Chanderdoorg. This was probably the original Pampā, and
Chanderdoorg the Ṛṣyamūka mountain. 
Subsequently the name was transferred from the tank
to the river which rose from it.
